title: Mag force on electron in coaxial cable

content.prompt: A coaxial cable consists of a cylindrical wire inside of a cylindrical shell of wire. The inner wire has a current I directed into the page, and the outer wire has a current I out of the page. An electron has a velocity directed into the page, as shown in the figure above. What is the direction of the magnetic force exerted on the electron?

choices.label: Toward the left side of the page
Toward the right side of the page
Toward the bottom of the page
There is no magnetic force on the electron because the magnetic field in the region between the inner and outer wires is parallel to the velocity.
There is no magnetic force on the electron because there is no magnetic field in the region between the inner and the outer wires.
